reviewText: This is by far the most annoying yoga DVD I own...and I own LOTS. Christine has the absolute most annoying speech/voice that I can't stand to listen to her to do the DVD. She emphasizes words so strangely...such as "in-haaaaaaale", "ex-haaaaaale"...OMG! If I could do the DVD without listening to her I would. I can't properly explain how very annoying this DVD is, but trust me, she's ridiculous.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'm an intermediate-advanced runner and I like doing yoga for flexibility and stretching. This DVD works that, plus it adds strength work for legs, hips and core. The poses are hold long enough to feel them, but not too long to be unbearable. I believe it's a great practice, it can look easy but it's intense! The only caveat is that is long (around 75 min). I also do like that Christine explains what you are working and why is good for runners, although I guess this can become irritating when you have heard in 1000 times. The studio is weird, kind of a castle?? or church?? Regarding the exercisers, they look normal people and I do like that. It makes you feel you are in a real class.  I do recommend the DVD regardless the cons,  not for daily practice, but once a week or so
Title: N/A

reviewText: I didn't know yoga could be so fun and challenging at the same time. She is a great instructor. I feel like she is actually teaching a class not just making a video for a company. My only complaint is the length of the workout.  It is an hour and 20 minutes.I can only make time to do this about once a week. It has help me with building strength and with flexibility. I would recommend this to anyone.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love it, it was fast shipping and I love this dvd. Now I have a dvd I can do when I can't get to my hot yoga days and I can use this after my liong runs. This stretches everything out,but it is not easy by any means
Title: N/A

reviewText: As an aging runner, I can't just run and go about my day...I have to stretch and strengthen too. Yoga has become an essential part of my routine. This program is the perfect compliment to my running. The instructor's cueing is precise and spot on. She hits all the hot spots..the hips, the hamstrings, everything in between. She forces you to hold the poses until you can't anymore. Even though I do this routine weekly, I'm usually sore after...which to me is a good thing. My beefs with this workout? It is boring. The participants are creepy and expressionless, except for the older woman, who tries to suppress a smile when the instructor is adjusting her. But overall, the merits of this program outweigh the negatives.
summary: I have a love/hate relationship with this workout...
Title: N/A

reviewText: Not very excited about this program. It's long, it's boring and it's not easy to fit in a yoga workout unless you're willing to give up an hour. Some people may be fine with this, but not me. The moves she shows are great, it's just too long!
summary: Not Real Happy with this Workout.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I bought this to help stretch my legs and improve my running. I have noticed my legs are not tightening up when I run and my stride is improving. I recommend this dvd for all runners. It is broken up into body sections or you can just do the whole dvd. It seems easy enough but you do still get sore the next morning so it must be toning.
Title: N/A
